item.description:
James D. Watson, a Nobel Prize winner for his role in the discovery of the structure of DNA, and Edward O. Wilson, a pioneer in the study of biodiversity and two-time Pulitzer Prize winner, will reflect on their storied careers, including their time together at Harvard, and look ahead to the key challenges for biological sciences in the 21st century. Moderated by Robert Krulwich, award-winning journalist and correspondent for National Public Radio.

Presented by the Harvard Museum of Natural History
Prices: $9.00; Harvard ID: $6.00; HMNH Members: $6.00

Buy tickets online at the Harvard Box Office in Holyoke Center, 1350 Mass Ave
OR
purchase them online at http://ofa.fas.harvar....
item.name: Looking Back, Looking Forward: A Conversation with James Watson and E. O. Wilson
